description.narrative: CMI! seeks to invest in the autonomy and capacity of marginalized women, girls and trans* people –including but not limited to indigenous and rural women, sex workers, LB women, HIV+ women and other groups of women, girls and trans* people that experience multiple layers of discrimination – organized in women’s rights organizations (WROs), movements and as women human rights defenders (WHRDs) to act as change agents and effectively lobby and advocate for the prevention and elimination of gender-based violence, for economic justice, and for sustainable resourcing of women’s rights organisations and movements. (Language: English)

title.narrative: Count Me In! 2020 Annual Report and Final Report

description.narrative: This report features select highlights of CMI!’s work in 2020 (stories of change across CMI!’s thematic areas and using complementary strategies) alongside a summary of CMI!’s key successes and lessons learned during the five-year programme.

This indicator consists of: 1) Extent to which the UN and relevant regional policies, recognize and intervene with or launch statements regarding critical situations for activists at risk (Language: English)

This indicator consists of: 1) Extent to which social norms, relevant to women's, girls?, and trans* people?s rights in relation to GBV and Economic Justice have shifted (in the civil society, public and corporate sectors) 2) Increased number of legal and policy changes related to women?s, girls? and trans* people?s rights, reflecting partner input
